sections.heading: Background
sections.content: In 1947 British India was divided into India and Pakistan, driven by religious and political tensions.

sections.heading: Migration
sections.content: Millions were displaced across the new borders, leading to communal violence.

sections.heading: Aftermath
sections.content: The partition created lasting hostility but also shaped modern South Asia.

sections.heading: Cultural Memory
sections.content: Stories of loss and longing continue to influence literature and art.
